values.title: gazebo8-doc package is broken on xenial

content.raw:
It may be broken on other platforms too, but I get the following error when trying to install:

~~~

~~~The following NEW packages will be installed:
  gazebo8-doc
0 upgraded, 1 newly installed, 0 to remove and 44 not upgraded.
Need to get 0 B/4,690 B of archives.
After this operation, 20.5 kB of additional disk space will be used.
(Reading database ... 1046440 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack .../gazebo8-doc_8.1.1-1~xenial_all.deb ...
Unpacking gazebo8-doc (8.1.1-1~xenial) ...
Processing triggers for doc-base (0.10.7) ...
Processing 1 added doc-base file...
Error in `/usr/share/doc-base/gazebo', line 9: all `Format' sections are invalid.
Note: `install-docs --verbose --check file_name' may give more details about the above error.
Setting up gazebo8-doc (8.1.1-1~xenial) ...
~~~

It looks in `/usr/share/doc-base/gazebo`, but I think it should look in `/usr/share/doc-base/gazebo8`?

cc @\_jrivero_
content.html:
It may be broken on other platforms too, but I get the following error when trying to install:

~~~The following NEW packages will be installed:
  gazebo8-doc
0 upgraded, 1 newly installed, 0 to remove and 44 not upgraded.
Need to get 0 B/4,690 B of archives.
After this operation, 20.5 kB of additional disk space will be used.
(Reading database ... 1046440 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack .../gazebo8-doc_8.1.1-1~xenial_all.deb ...
Unpacking gazebo8-doc (8.1.1-1~xenial) ...
Processing triggers for doc-base (0.10.7) ...
Processing 1 added doc-base file...
Error in `/usr/share/doc-base/gazebo', line 9: all `Format' sections are invalid.
Note: `install-docs --verbose --check file_name' may give more details about the above error.
Setting up gazebo8-doc (8.1.1-1~xenial) ...

It looks in /usr/share/doc-base/gazebo, but I think it should look in /usr/share/doc-base/gazebo8?

cc @_jrivero_

values.title: gazebo sun and ground plane models are not installed

content.raw:
launching gazebo the first time on machines with a fresh install will always try to download these two models from the database. I think this gives bad user experience especially for new users who don't know how to turn on the verbose mode or if they don't have internet connection.

The problem doesn't occur with source installs because the sun and ground planes models are installed in `[prefix]/share/gazebo-*/models`, and our `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` is conveniently set up to look in that directory.

I think this is probably just a matter of updating `gazebo.install` file to include that directory?
content.html:
launching gazebo the first time on machines with a fresh install will always try to download these two models from the database. I think this gives bad user experience especially for new users who don't know how to turn on the verbose mode or if they don't have internet connection.

The problem doesn't occur with source installs because the sun and ground planes models are installed in [prefix]/share/gazebo-*/models, and our GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH is conveniently set up to look in that directory.

I think this is probably just a matter of updating gazebo.install file to include that directory?
